intro: Helichrysum apiculatum var. typicum, commonly known as the golden everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its densely packed, bright yellow to golden-orange flowers that are tightly clustered in heads. The plant produces small, narrow leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It is a hardy perennial that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun. Its flowers are long-lasting when dried, making it a popular choice for floral arrangements.
